idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 3; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.1.3000

descript.abstract: These data describe scaled injury in units of Discounted Service Acre Years (DSAY) for a particular scenario within a Habitat Equivalency Analysis (HEA). See the HEA Tool documentation, HEA GIS Tools documentation, and accompanying Query Manager documentation for additional details.
descript.purpose: Habitat Equivalency Analysis (HEA) is an industry standard analytical approach for scaling ecological restoration. The HEA Tool that generated these data was developed to standardize and document spatial and analytical methods used to conducte these analyses. Specifically, these data describe scaled injury per raster grid cell in units of DSAYs for a particular scenario within a given set HEA calculations.

citeinfo.origin: National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) National Ocean Service (NOS) Office of Response and Restoration (ORR)
citeinfo.title: DSAY_SC1

overview.dsoverv: These data have been generated from one or more aggregated raw data sets, interpolated and processed by a suite of HEA GIS Tools, and passed to a database tool designed to conducte HEA according to user specified parameters. See the HEA Tool documentation, HEA GIS Tools documentation, and accompanying Query Manager documentation for additional details.
overview.eaover: These data describe scaled injury per raster grid cell in units of DSAYs for a particular scenario within a given set HEA calculations.
overview.eadetcit: See the HEA GIS Tools documentation, data set lineage, and accompanying Query Manager documentation for additional details.

citeinfo.title: NOAA ORR Query Manager
citeinfo.origin: National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) National Ocean Service (NOS) Office of Response and Restoration (ORR)

srcinfo.srccontr: Typically, these data have been exported from NOAA ORRs Query Manager database, imported into ArcGIS via the use of standardized import tools, further processed and interpolated by the automated HEA GIS Tools.

citeinfo.title: NOAA HEA Tool
citeinfo.origin: National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) National Ocean Service (NOS) Office of Response and Restoration (ORR)

srcinfo.srccontr: These data have been processed by a database tool designed to conducte HEA according to user specified parameters.

attracc.attraccr: These data have been generated from one or more aggregated raw data sets, interpolated and processed by a suite of HEA GIS Tools, and passed to a database tool designed to conducte HEA according to user specified parameters. Attribute accuracy is dependent upon these sources, processes and choices, but is standardized. These data have not been formally evaluated for attribute accuracy as part of the HEA GIS Tool processing. See the HEA Tool documentation, HEA GIS Tools documentation, and accompanying Query Manager documentation for additional details.

dataqual.logic: These data have been generated from one or more aggregated raw data sets, interpolated and processed by a suite of HEA GIS Tools, and passed to a database tool designed to conducte HEA according to user specified parameters. Logical consistency is dependent upon these sources, processes and choices, but is standardized. These data have not been formally evaluated for logical consistency as part of the HEA GIS Tool processing. See the HEA Tool documentation, HEA GIS Tools documentation, and accompanying Query Manager documentation for additional details.
dataqual.complete: These data have been generated from one or more aggregated raw data sets, interpolated and processed by a suite of HEA GIS Tools, and passed to a database tool designed to conducte HEA according to user specified parameters. The data are therefore as complete as these sources, processes and choices dictate. These data have not been formally evaluated for completeness as part of the HEA GIS Tool processing. See the HEA Tool documentation, HEA GIS Tools documentation, and accompanying Query Manager documentation for additional details.

horizpa.horizpar: These data have been generated from one or more aggregated raw data sets, interpolated and processed by a suite of HEA GIS Tools, and passed to a database tool designed to conducte HEA according to user specified parameters. Horizontal spatial accuracy is dependent upon these sources, processes and choices, but is standardized. These data have not been formally evaluated for horizontal spatial accuracy as part of the HEA GIS Tool processing. See the HEA Tool documentation, HEA GIS Tools documentation, and accompanying Query Manager documentation for additional details.

vertacc.vertaccr: These data have been generated from one or more aggregated raw data sets, interpolated and processed by a suite of HEA GIS Tools, and passed to a database tool designed to conducte HEA according to user specified parameters. Vertical spatial accuracy is dependent upon these sources, processes and choices, but is standardized. These data have not been formally evaluated for vertical spatial accuracy as part of the HEA GIS Tool processing. See the HEA Tool documentation, HEA GIS Tools documentation, and accompanying Query Manager documentation for additional details.
